summary:
Dwarfism is when people or animals are much smaller than usual. In humans, it means being under 4 feet 10 inches tall. There are different types: some people have short limbs, while others are small all over. Most people with dwarfism have normal intelligence and can live long, healthy lives.

The most common type is achondroplasia, a genetic condition. Other causes include hormone problems. Treatment depends on the cause, sometimes including surgery or hormone therapy. People with dwarfism might face discrimination and need special accommodations.
title: Dwarfism
